A child is abandoned on the steps of the Capuchin monastery in the seventeenth century in Spain. She grows following the customs of the monks and becomes one of the most important preachers of the faith. While his speeches charmed crowds, internally, the fame and the "power" of Ambrose (Vincent Cassel) caused a relative envy among his peers.
